title: Transforming Atonement: A Political Theology of the Cross
An attempt to recapture the socially transformative meaning of Jesus’ cross

container-title: which provides a succinct overview of feminist Christologies up to the
title: Consider Jesus: Waves of Renewal in Christology
See especially chapter 7, “Feminist Christology
The Power of the Cross: Foundations for a Christian Feminist Ethic of Community
A feminist appropriation of the cross as socially transformative
Christ and Empire: From Paul to Postcolonial Times
Evaluates Christologies from Paul to the present in terms of a social justice perspective congruent with that of Ruether
Crucified Woman
A study of responses to the sculpture Crucified Woman by Almuth Lutkenhaus-Lackey
With Passion and Compassion: Third World Women Doing Theology
Has several essays by African and Asian women in which the Christus Victor model of the atonement is adopted to express Jesus’ saving significance
Deceiving the Devil: Atonement, Abuse, and Ransom
A more recent attempt to retrieve the Christus Victor understanding of Jesus’ saving significance

note: resurrection is interpreted in the Christologies in this chapter.
title: On Naming the Present: On God, Hermeneutics, and Church
Addresses some issues concerning the intelligibility of the way Jesus
A brief feminist reappropriation of Anselm’s interpretation of the cross
The Cross in Our Context: Jesus and the Suffering World
A succinct summary of Hall’s theology of the cross
Origins of the Theology of Hope
A good study of the early sources of Moltmann’s eschatology
The Crucified God: The Cross as the Foundation and Criticism of Christian Theology
The Way of Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ for Today’s World
An Indian Jesus from Ś ankara’s Thought
An interpretation of Jesus from a cultural perspective shaped by Vedanta Hinduism, which enters into dialogue with Panikkar’s Christology
Christ in a Pluralistic Age
This is Cobb’s major effort in Christology. It is a very original and stimulating work
Transforming Christianity and the World: A Way beyond Absolutism and Relativism
This collection of essays helps document the development of Cobb’s Christology through the 1970s, 1980s, and 1990s
Theology and Religious Pluralism: The Challenge of Other Religions
Gives a concise account of the exclusivist, inclusivist, and pluralist approaches to relating Jesus Christ to other religions
Jesus Christ at the Encounter of World Religions
This book focuses primarily on the encounter of Christianity and Hinduism in India, and develops the basis of Dupuis’ mature position
Who Do You Say That I Am?: Introduction to Christology
This book focuses directly on Christology and provides the Christological underpinnings for Dupuis’s theology of interreligious dialogue
Toward a Christian Theology of Religious Pluralism
This is Dupuis’s mature statement of his understanding of the relationship of Christian faith to other religions
Christianity and Other Religions: Selected Readings
Gives a representative selection of different approaches to the question of how Jesus Christ relates to other religions
No Other Name? A Critical Survey of Christian Attitudes toward the World Religions
An important critical survey of various understandings of Jesus’ relationship to other religions from a pluralist perspective
Christophany: The Fullness of Man
Panikkar’s most recent contribution. A beautifully written presentation of his mature vision
The Unknown Christ of Hinduism
This was Panikkar’s first major work in Christology
Christ in a Post-Christian World: How Can We Believe in Jesus Christ When Those Around Us Believe Differently—Or Not at All?
An attempt to formulate an understanding of Jesus as enabling a stance of bounded openness to other religions from a feminist perspective
Suggestions for Further Reading Bohache, Thomas. Christology from the Margins
Develops a queer Christology
Christ in Evolution
Writing from a Franciscan perspective, Delio develops a Christology in relation to the findings of the natural sciences and the pluralism of religions and cultures
Pannenberg’s unique apologetic approach, while politically conservative, did much to establish the theological significance of the quest for the historical Jesus for contemporary Christology
Jesus the Savior: The Meaning of Jesus Christ for Christian Faith
An accessibly written and insightful Christology from an American postliberal approach
Jesus: An Experiment in Christology
Christ: The Experience of Jesus as Lord
These huge books by Schillebeeckx were an important and influential attempt to develop Christology in sustained dialogue with contemporary biblical scholarship

Christ Beyond Creative Transformation

This dialectical relationship between the understanding of Jesus and its practical effects reflects the relationship in Cobb’s thought between faith in Jesus Christ and speculative thought. He understands speculative thought to be continually open to revision in light of new knowledge and experiences. As this happens, one’s understanding of Christ is also revised. Thus, while one believes in Jesus Christ and is guided by this, one’s understanding of Christ is continually open to revision
